hint.text: Welcome to the first real puzzle! You will be guided through how puzzles work.
At the top of the screen you can see a set of puzzle related buttons.
The Info is shown on hover and opens up a window with additional info that can be helpful for solving the puzzle. It is only available on some puzzles.
The Objective is shown on click and tells you in plain text what the puzzle requires.
The Check Logic button checks your current creation against the Truth Table to determine if it satisfies the objective. Click to activate.
The Step Logic button goes through each input-combination in increments. Which means you can see how your creation interacts with input on a step by step basis. Click to activate.
The Truth Table is shown on hover. It shows what input is required for a given output.
Now, in this game you will place tiles (for example wires) which can either be POWERED (green) or NOT POWERED (red).
Powered tiles will send its signal to other tiles you have connected to them.
There are 2 locked tiles on the grid, 'A' and '1'. 'A' is an output, which means it will be powered when you click the Check Logic Button.
'1' is the input, which means it is where you have to connect your wires to.
That is all you need to get started! Give it a try on this puzzle and good luck on your Boolean journey!
